com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware

Interface DcMotorController

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HardwareDevice
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HiTechnicNxtDcMotorController, MatrixDcMotorController, ModernRoboticsUsbDcMotorController

    public interface DcMotorController
extends HardwareDevice
    Represents a HiTechnic, Modern Robotics, or Matrix motor controller. Motor controllers are attached to 2 motors (4 in the case of the Matrix one). Motors are moved by sending DC voltage in pulses. In order to figure out how far the motors have turned, it is possible to attach an "encoder" that will keep track of the motor's motion.
    See Also:
    DcMotor

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareDevice

        HardwareDevice.Manufacturer

    • Method Detail

      • setMotorMode

        void setMotorMode(int motor,
                  DcMotor.RunMode mode)
        Changes the mode in which the motor controller is moving the motor. The mode defaults to RUN_WITHOUT_ENCODERS.
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        mode - the run mode to use
        See Also:
        DcMotor.RunMode

      • getMotorMode

        DcMotor.RunMode getMotorMode(int motor)
        Get the current motor mode. Returns the current "run mode".
        Parameters:
        motor - port of motor
        Returns:
        run mode

      • setMotorPower

        void setMotorPower(int motor,
                   double power)
        Sets the motor's power, where -1.0 means full power backwards, 0.0 means stopped, and 1.0 means full power forward. In RUN_TO_POSITION mode, sets the maximum power to send to the motor.
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        power - the desired power

      • getMotorPower

        double getMotorPower(int motor)
        Returns the power that the motor is moving at, where -1.0 means full power backwards, 0.0 means stopped or coasting, and 1.0 means full power forward.
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        Returns:
        the motor's power value
        See Also:
        setMotorPower(int, double)

      • setMotorMaxSpeed

        void setMotorMaxSpeed(int motor,
                      int encoderTicksPerSecond)
        Sets the maximum targetable motor speed when the indicated motor is running in one of the PID motor modes.
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor in question
        encoderTicksPerSecond - the new maximum targetable motor speed, in units of encoder ticks per second
        See Also:
        DcMotor.setMaxSpeed(int)

      • getMotorMaxSpeed

        int getMotorMaxSpeed(int motor)
        Returns the current maximum targetable motor speed when the indicated motor is running in one of the PID modes
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor in question
        Returns:
        the current maximum targetable speed of that motor, in units of encoder ticks per second
        See Also:
        DcMotor.getMaxSpeed()

      • isBusy

        boolean isBusy(int motor)
        Returns whether the robot has not yet reached its target position. Don't rely on the return value if not in the RUN_TO_POSITION mode.
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        Returns:
        false if the motor has stopped, true otherwise

      • setMotorZeroPowerBehavior

        void setMotorZeroPowerBehavior(int motor,
                               DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior zeroPowerBehavior)
        Sets the behavior of the motor when zero power is applied.
        Parameters:
        zeroPowerBehavior - the behavior of the motor when zero power is applied.

      • getMotorZeroPowerBehavior

        DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior getMotorZeroPowerBehavior(int motor)
        Returns the current zero power behavior of the motor.
        Returns:
        the current zero power behavior of the motor.

      • getMotorPowerFloat

        boolean getMotorPowerFloat(int motor)
        Returns whether the controller has told the motor to coast (put minimal resistance on it).
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        Returns:
        true if the motor is coasting, false if not
        See Also:
        setMotorZeroPowerBehavior(int, DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior), setMotorPower(int, double)

      • setMotorTargetPosition

        void setMotorTargetPosition(int motor,
                            int position)
        Sets the desired encoder position for the motor. It will automatically move there (requires an encoder to be attached). Should only be used in the RUN_TO_POSITION mode.
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        position - the target encoder position
        See Also:
        getMotorCurrentPosition(int), getMotorTargetPosition(int)

      • getMotorTargetPosition

        int getMotorTargetPosition(int motor)
        Returns the encoder position that the motor has been told to move to if in the RUN_TO_POSITION mode
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        Returns:
        the target encoder position
        See Also:
        getMotorCurrentPosition(int), setMotorTargetPosition(int, int)

      • getMotorCurrentPosition

        int getMotorCurrentPosition(int motor)
        Gets the current value of the encoder. The number of encoder ticks per revolution depends on the motor encoder being used. For example, Tetrix motors have 1440 ticks/rev and Andymark NeveRest 40 motors have 1120.
        Parameters:
        motor - the motor port number (1 to 2 or 1 to 4)
        Returns:
        the encoder tick count
